content:
Would it be good to document the actual OS versions used for automated testing of Rust? Tier 1 puts emphasis on the automated testing so I think it might be helpful to have a page that spells out exactly what that means. I'd guess this might be the sort of thing that's already logged somewhere?

I'm not sure if this is compiler or infra so I'll put it here.
I think a main concern would be that the entire thing isn't up to us.
For example, we use whatever version of Xcode is installed by GHA
Since we wouldn't be the primary source of truth, at best we could link to some other resource.
(I've implicitly expanded "operating system" into "tools used when building the code")
Hm. Can the CI be used to create a "live" report of the tool versions used?
By "live" I mean at the time of the last nightly build or something along those lines.

It's hidden, but parts of that are already available:

image.png
ci logs get deleted after a certain period.
